tn.text: Here "face" is a metonym for Yahweh's presence. This means David prayed to Yahweh for an answer about the famine. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])

tn.ref: because of Saul and his murderous family
tn.text: Saul had killed many Gibeonites, and Saul's descendants are guilty because of this sin.
Here "Now" marks a break in the main storyline. This gives background information about the Gibeonites. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_background]])

tn.ref: What should I do for you? How can I make atonement ... promises?
tn.text: These two sentences have similar meanings. AT: "What can I do to remove this sin, so that you may bless the people of Yahweh, who inherit his goodness and promises?" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_parallelism]])

tn.ref: It is not a matter of silver or gold
tn.text: "Money will not solve the problem"
"who made plans against us"

tn.ref: let seven men from his descendants be handed over to us
tn.text: This can be stated in active form. AT: "allow your men to give seven of his descendants to us" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"we will execute them by hanging"
Saul was from the town of Gibeah.
This can be stated in active form. AT: "the one whom Yahweh chose" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Mephibosheth was the son of Jonathan. See how you translated his name in [[:en:bible:notes:2sa:04:04|4:4]].
Rizpah was a woman and her father was Aiah. See how you translated these names in [[:en:bible:notes:2sa:03:06|3:7]].
These are names of men. This is not the same Mephibosheth as the son of Jonathan. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of a woman. See how you translated it in [[:en:bible:notes:2sa:03:12|3:13]].
This is the name of a people group. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: He handed them over into the hands of the Gibeonites
tn.text: Here "the hands of the Gibeonites" is a metonym for the Gibeonite people. AT: "He gave them to the Gibeonites" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
This can be translated in active form. AT: "The Gibeonites put them to death" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Rizpah was a woman and her father was Aiah. See how you translated these names in [[:en:bible:notes:2sa:03:06|3:7]].
This can be translated in active form. AT: "Someone told David" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
Jabesh is a town in the region of Gilead. See how you translated this in [[:en:bible:notes:2sa:02:04|2:4]].
This is an area near the city gate where people did various kinds of business.
This is the name of a place. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
Translate this the same way you did in [[:en:bible:notes:2sa:01:06|1:6]].
This can be translated in active form. AT: "whom the Gibeonites executed by hanging" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This is the name of a town in Benjamin. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This is the name of a man. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"Saul's father"
This is the name of a man. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
"300 shekels." This is about 3.4 kilograms. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_bweight]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
Abishai and Zeruiah are names of men. See how you translated these names in [[:en:bible:notes:2sa:02:18|2:18]].

tn.ref: you do not put out the lamp of Israel
tn.text: The "lamp of Israel" is a metaphor that refers to David's leadership and the idea that if David were to die, the people of Israel would have no clear direction. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

tn.ref: It came about after this that
tn.text: This phrase marks the beginning of a new part of the story. If your language has a way for doing this, you could consider using it here.
This is the name of a town. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: Sibbecai ... Saph ... Elhanan son of Jari ... Goliath
tn.text: These are names of men. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are names of people groups. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This people group was known for its giant warriors. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: whose spear was like a weaver's beam
tn.text: When a person was weaving a cloth he would run the threads through hooks attached to large sticks called a "weaver's beam." This means Goliath's spear was larger than a normal spear. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
four in number** - "24 fingers and toes altogether" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])
This people group was known for its giant warriors. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
These are names of men. Shammah was David's brother. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])

tn.ref: and they were killed by the hand of David and by the hand of his soldiers
tn.text: Here "by the hand of" means "through" or "by." This can be stated in active form. AT: "and David and his soldiers killed them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
